properties.name: Target_Network_Name
properties.description: Enter the name of your target network. It must match an existing network name.

properties.name: New_Network_Name
properties.description: Type in the new network name.

**Cisco Meraki - Networks - Get Organization Networks**

List the networks that the user has privileges on in an organization

**Target:** A Meraki Endpoint using HTTPS "api.meraki.com" port 443 and no path.

**Account Key:** Meraki User API Key. API Key can be generated from Meraki Dashboard -> User Profile -> API Access.

Steps:
[] Sends Get Network request to Meraki
[] Check if the request was successful:
[]> If it was, attempt to extract the results and set the output variables
[]> If it wasn't, return the error and marks the workflow as failed.

NOTE: Empty attributes in the request are removed from the payload before sending to Meraki. 

More information about this API: https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/get-organization-networks/

**Cisco Meraki - Networks - Update Network**

Update a network in Meraki Organization. To create a combined network, select more than one Product Types task will automatically create the network as combined type.

**Target:** A Meraki Endpoint using HTTPS "api.meraki.com" port 443 and no path.

**Account Key:** Meraki User API Key. API Key can be generated from Meraki Dashboard -> User Profile -> API Access.

Steps:
[] Sends Update Network request to Meraki
[] Check if the request was successful:
[]> If it was, attempt to extract the results and set the output variables
[]> If it wasn't, return the error and marks the workflow as failed.

NOTE: Empty attributes in the request are removed from the payload before sending to Meraki. 

More information about this API: https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/update-network/

**Cisco Meraki - Devices - Get Organization Devices**

List the devices in an organization that have been assigned to networks.

**Target:** A Meraki Endpoint using HTTPS "api.meraki.com" port 443 and no path.

**Account Key:** Meraki User API Key. API Key can be generated from Meraki Dashboard -> User Profile -> API Access.

Steps:
[] Sends Get Network request to Meraki
[] Check if the request was successful:
[]> If it was, attempt to extract the results and set the output variables
[]> If it wasn't, return the error and marks the workflow as failed.

NOTE: Empty attributes in the request are removed from the payload before sending to Meraki. 

More information about this API: https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/get-organization-networks/

**Cisco Meraki - Devices - Update Device**
Update information about a specific Meraki device within the network.

**Target:** A Meraki Endpoint using HTTPS "api.meraki.com" port 443 and no path.

**Account Key:** Meraki User API Key. API Key can be generated from Meraki Dashboard -> User Profile -> API Access.

Steps:
[] Sends Update Device request to Meraki
[] Check if the request was successful:
[]> If it was, attempt to extract the results and set the output variables
[]> If it wasn't, return the error and marks the workflow as failed.

NOTE: Empty attributes in the request are removed from the payload before sending to Meraki. 

https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-v1/update-device/
